text: This is Mika. Mika’s mom owns a bookshop, and sometimes Mika helps out. Earlier today, Mika was organizing books on tables and shelves. Mika put a very large stack of blue books on the desk, a medium-sized stack of red books on the table, and a small stack of yellow books on the shelf.
es-CO: Esta es Melisa. La madre de Melisa tiene una librería y Melisa a veces la ayuda. Hace un rato, Melisa estaba organizando unos libros en las mesas y biblioteca. Melisa puso una torre muy grande de libros azules en el escritorio, una torre mediana de libros rojos en la mesa y una torre pequeña de libros amarillos en la biblioteca.
de: Das ist Mika. Mikas Mutter hat eine Buchhandlung, und manchmal hilft Mika dort mit. Heute hat Mika die Bücher auf Tischen und Regalen sortiert. Mika hat einen sehr großen Stapel blauer Bücher auf den Schreibtisch gelegt, einen mittelgroßen Stapel roter Bücher auf den Tisch und einen kleinen Stapel gelber Bücher ins Regal.
fr-CA: This is Mika. Mika’s mom owns a bookshop, and sometimes Mika helps out. Earlier today, Mika was organizing books on tables and shelves. Mika put a very large stack of blue books on the desk, a medium-sized stack of red books on the table, and a small stack of yellow books on the shelf.
nl: This is Mika. Mika’s mom owns a bookshop, and sometimes Mika helps out. Earlier today, Mika was organizing books on tables and shelves. Mika put a very large stack of blue books on the desk, a medium-sized stack of red books on the table, and a small stack of yellow books on the shelf.
de-CH: Das ist Mika. Mikas Mutter hat eine Buchhandlung, und manchmal hilft Mika dort mit. Heute hat Mika die Bücher auf Tischen und Regalen sortiert. Mika hat einen sehr großen Stapel blauer Bücher auf den Schreibtisch gelegt, einen mittelgroßen Stapel roter Bücher auf den Tisch und einen kleinen Stapel gelber Bücher ins Regal.

text: Mika’s mom just walked in. Mom asks Mika for one of the books. Mika remembers where the book is, and tells mom, “The book is in the small stack!”
es-CO: La madre de Melisa acaba de entrar. La madre le pide a Melisa uno de los libros. Melisa recuerda dónde está ese libro y le dice a su mamá: "¡El libro está en la torre pequeña!".
de: Mikas Mutter kommt gerade herein. Mama fragt Mika nach einem der Bücher. Mika erinnert sich, wo das Buch ist, und sagt zu Mama: „Das Buch ist in dem kleinen Stapel!“
fr-CA: Mika’s mom just walked in. Mom asks Mika for one of the books. Mika remembers where the book is, and tells mom, “The book is in the small stack!”

es-AR: Mika’s mom just walked in. Mom asks Mika for one of the books. Mika remembers where the book is, and tells mom, “The book is in the small stack!”

text: Mom looks in the wrong stack of books and can’t find the book that she wanted. How do you think Mom feels about not finding the book she wanted?
es-CO: La mamá busca en la torre de libros equivocada y no encuentra el libro que quería. ¿Cómo crees que se siente la mamá al no encontrar el libro que quería?
de: Mama schaut in den falschen Stapel und findet das Buch nicht, das sie gesucht hat. Was glaubst du, wie Mama sich fühlt, wenn sie das gewünschte Buch nicht findet?
fr-CA: Mom looks in the wrong stack of books and can’t find the book that she wanted. How do you think Mom feels about not finding the book she wanted?

text: George and Kat are playing together. They look outside and see a new toy shop across the street. Kat decides to go buy some new toys at the toy shop. Kat asks George what toy he would like to have, and George says he would like a new basketball.
es-CO: Jorge y Catalina están jugando juntos. Miran fuera y ven una juguetería nueva al otro lado de la calle. Catalina decide ir a comprar juguetes a la juguetería. Catalina le pregunta a Jorge cuál juguete le gustaría tener y Jorge dice que le gustaría un balón de baloncesto nuevo.
de: Georg und Theresa spielen zusammen. Sie schauen nach draußen und sehen auf der anderen Straßenseite ein neues Spielzeuggeschäft. Theresa beschließt, ein paar neue Spielsachen in dem Geschäft zu kaufen. Theresa fragt Georg, welches Spielzeug er gerne hätte, und Georg sagt, er hätte gerne einen neuen Basketball.
fr-CA: George and Kat are playing together. They look outside and see a new toy shop across the street. Kat decides to go buy some new toys at the toy shop. Kat asks George what toy he would like to have, and George says he would like a new basketball.
nl: George and Kat are playing together. They look outside and see a new toy shop across the street. Kat decides to go buy some new toys at the toy shop. Kat asks George what toy he would like to have, and George says he would like a new basketball.

Theresa beschließt, ein paar neue Spielsachen in dem Geschäft zu kaufen. Theresa fragt Georg, welches Spielzeug er gerne hätte, und Georg sagt, er hätte gerne einen neuen Basketball.
es-AR: George and Kat are playing together. They look outside and see a new toy shop across the street. Kat decides to go buy some new toys at the toy shop. Kat asks George what toy he would like to have, and George says he would like a new basketball.
en-GH: George and Kat are playing together. They look outside and see a new toy shop across the street. Kat decides to go buy some new toys at the toy shop. Kat asks George what toy he would like to have, and George says he would like a new basketball.

text: While Kat is walking to the toy shop, George changes his mind and yells to Kat, “Actually, can I please have some crayons?” But Kat did not hear George ask for crayons.
es-CO: Mientras Catalina caminaba a la juguetería, Jorge cambió de opinión y le gritó a Catalina: "En realidad, ¿me compras unos colores, por favor?". Pero Catalina no escuchó a Jorge pedir los colores.
de: Während Theresa zum Spielzeugladen geht, ändert Georg seine Meinung und ruft Theresa zu: „Kann ich bitte ein paar Buntstifte haben?“ Aber Theresa hat nicht gehört, wie Georg nach Buntstiften gefragt hat.

text: Kat didn’t hear George say that he wanted crayons. So Kat thinks George wants a basketball. Kat goes to the toy shop, but then the shop owner says that they don’t have any basketballs! But they do have storybooks, so Kat buys a storybook for George instead.
es-CO: Catalina no escuchó a Jorge decir que quería unos colores, así que Catalina piensa que Jorge quiere un balón de baloncesto. Catalina va a la juguetería, pero el dueño le dice aunque no tienen balones de baloncesto, sí tienen libros de cuentos. Catalina le compra un libro de cuentos a Jorge.
de: Theresa hat Georg nicht sagen hören, dass er Buntstifte haben möchte. Deshalb glaubt Theresa, dass Georg sich einen Basketball wünscht. Theresa geht in den Spielzeugladen, aber der Ladenbesitzer sagt, dass sie keine Basketbälle haben! Aber sie haben Märchenbücher, also kauft Theresa stattdessen ein Märchenbuch für Georg.

text: Read each story carefully. Think about what happened in the story and what you know. Choose the best answer for each question.

en-GH: Here are two pictures. Something's the same. They're both medium.

text: Here are two pictures. Something's the same. They're both large.

text: Here is another picture. Which of these pictures is the same as this new picture?
es-CO: Aquí hay otra imagen. ¿Cuál de estas imágenes es igual a esta nueva imagen?
de: Hier ist ein weiteres Bild. Welches dieser Bilder ist gleich dem neuen Bild?

nl: Here is another picture. Which of these pictures is the same as this new picture?

es-AR: Here is another picture. Which of these pictures is the same as this new picture?
en-GH: Here is another picture. Which of these pictures is the same as this new picture?

text: Here are the same pictures. Choose two of them that are the same in a different way.
es-CO: Aquí están las mismas imágenes. Elige dos de ellas que sean iguales de otra manera.
de: Hier sind die gleichen Bilder. Wählen Sie zwei davon aus, die auf eine andere Weise gleich sind.

de: Hier sind einige neue Bilder. Wählen Sie zwei davon aus, die in irgendeiner Weise gleich sind.

nl: Here are some new pictures. Choose two of them that are the same in some way.

text: Now choose two pictures that are the same in a different way.

de: Jetzt wähle zwei Bilder aus, die auf eine andere Weise gleich sind.
fr-CA: Now choose two pictures that are the same in a different way.
nl: Now choose two pictures that are the same in a different way.

text: Choose three pictures that are the same in only one way.

fr-CA: Choose three pictures that are the same in only one way.
nl: Choose three pictures that are the same in only one way.

es-AR: Choose three pictures that are the same in only one way.
en-GH: Choose three pictures that are the same in only one way.

text: Choose another three pictures that are the same in only one way.

nl: Choose another three pictures that are the same in only one way.

es-AR: Choose another three pictures that are the same in only one way.

text: Here are three pictures. I have to choose two of them that are the same in some way. I will pick these two pictures because they are both triangles.

nl: Here are three pictures. I have to choose two of them that are the same in some way. I will pick these two pictures because they are both triangles.

text: I have SERIOUS CONCERNS about these data (e.g., the child did not seem to understand the task, was frequently distracted/interrupted, etc.)
es-CO: Tengo GRANDES PREOCUPACIONES sobre estos datos (p. ej., el niño no parecía entender la tarea, se distrajo o interrumpió con frecuencia, etc.)
de: Ich habe ERNSTHAFTE BEDENKEN bezüglich dieser Daten (z. B. das Kind schien die Aufgabe nicht zu verstehen, war häufig abgelenkt/unterbrochen, etc.)
fr-CA: I have SERIOUS CONCERNS about these data (e.g., the child did not seem to understand the task, was frequently distracted/interrupted, etc.)
nl: I have SERIOUS CONCERNS about these data (e.g., the child did not seem to understand the task, was frequently distracted/interrupted, etc.)
de-CH: Ich habe ERNSTHAFTE BEDENKEN bezüglich dieser Daten (z. B. das Kind schien die Aufgabe nicht zu verstehen, war häufig abgelenkt/unterbrochen, etc.)
es-AR: I have SERIOUS CONCERNS about these data (e.g., the child did not seem to understand the task, was frequently distracted/interrupted, etc.)
en-GH: I have SERIOUS CONCERNS about these data (e.g., the child did not seem to understand the task, was frequently distracted/interrupted, etc.)

text: I feel OK about these data (e.g., the child seemed to understand the task pretty well, only experienced a few distractions/interruptions, etc.)
es-CO: Me siento bien con estos datos (p. ej., el niño parecía entender la tarea bastante bien, solo tuvo algunas distracciones/interrupciones, etc.)
de: Ich fühle mich OK mit diesen Daten (z. B. das Kind schien die Aufgabe ziemlich gut zu verstehen, erlebte nur wenige Ablenkungen/Unterbrechungen, etc.)

nl: I feel OK about these data (e.g., the child seemed to understand the task pretty well, only experienced a few distractions/interruptions, etc.)

es-AR: I feel OK about these data (e.g., the child seemed to understand the task pretty well, only experienced a few distractions/interruptions, etc.)
en-GH: I feel OK about these data (e.g., the child seemed to understand the task pretty well, only experienced a few distractions/interruptions, etc.)

text: I feel GOOD about these data (e.g., the child clearly understood the task, had very few (if any) distractions/ interruptions, etc.)
es-CO: Me siento BIEN con estos datos (p. ej., el niño entendió claramente la tarea, tuvo muy pocas (o ninguna) distracciones/interrupciones, etc.)
de: Ich fühle mich GUT mit diesen Daten (z. B. das Kind verstand die Aufgabe klar, hatte sehr wenige (wenn überhaupt) Ablenkungen/Unterbrechungen, etc.)

nl: I feel GOOD about these data (e.g., the child clearly understood the task, had very few (if any) distractions/ interruptions, etc.)

es-AR: I feel GOOD about these data (e.g., the child clearly understood the task, had very few (if any) distractions/ interruptions, etc.)

text:
In this game, you will play with numbers.

Some questions might be easy for you and some might be hard. That is okay! Please try your best and take your time. Let’s get started!
es-CO:
En este juego, jugarás con números.

Algunas preguntas pueden ser fáciles para ti y algunas pueden ser difíciles. ¡Está bien! Haz tu mejor esfuerzo y tómate tu tiempo. ¡Comencemos!
de:
In diesem Spiel wirst du mit Zahlen spielen.

Einige Fragen könnten einfach für dich sein und andere schwer. Das ist in Ordnung! Bitte gib dein Bestes und nimm dir Zeit. Lass uns beginnen!
fr-CA:
In this game, you will play with numbers.

Some questions might be easy for you and some might be hard. That is okay! Please try your best and take your time. Let’s get started!
nl:
In this game, you will play with numbers.

Some questions might be easy for you and some might be hard. That is okay! Please try your best and take your time. Let’s get started!
de-CH:
In diesem Spiel wirst du mit Zahlen spielen.

Einige Fragen könnten einfach für dich sein und andere schwer. Das ist in Ordnung! Bitte gib dein Bestes und nimm dir Zeit. Lass uns beginnen!
es-AR:
In this game, you will play with numbers.

Some questions might be easy for you and some might be hard. That is okay! Please try your best and take your time. Let’s get started!
en-GH:
In this game, you will play with numbers.

Some questions might be easy for you and some might be hard. That is okay! Please try your best and take your time. Let’s get started!

text: It's time for the first number game! Let's practice.
es-CO: ¡Es hora del primer juego de números! Vamos a practicar.
de: Es ist Zeit für das erste Zahlenspiel! Lass uns üben.
fr-CA: It's time for the first number game! Let's practice.
nl: It's time for the first number game! Let's practice.
de-CH: Es ist Zeit für das erste Zahlenspiel! Lass uns üben.
es-AR: It's time for the first number game! Let's practice.
en-GH: It's time for the first number game! Let's practice.

text: It's time for the next number game! Let's practice.
es-CO: ¡Es hora del siguiente juego de números! Vamos a practicar.
de: Es ist Zeit für das nächste Zahlenspiel! Lass uns üben.
fr-CA: It's time for the next number game! Let's practice.
nl: It's time for the next number game! Let's practice.
de-CH: Es ist Zeit für das nächste Zahlenspiel! Lass uns üben.
es-AR: It's time for the next number game! Let's practice.
en-GH: It's time for the next number game! Let's practice.

text: In this number game, you will say how many things are in the picture! The grownup helping you will press the button.
es-CO: En este juego de números, dirás cuántas cosas hay en la imagen. El adulto que te está ayudando presionará el botón.
de: In diesem Zahlenspiel sagst du, wie viele Dinge auf dem Bild sind! Der Erwachsene, der dir hilft, wird den Knopf drücken.
fr-CA: In this number game, you will say how many things are in the picture! The grownup helping you will press the button.
nl: In this number game, you will say how many things are in the picture! The grownup helping you will press the button.
de-CH: In diesem Zahlenspiel sagst du, wie viele Dinge auf dem Bild sind! Der Erwachsene, der dir hilft, wird den Knopf drücken.
es-AR: In this number game, you will say how many things are in the picture! The grownup helping you will press the button.
en-GH: In this number game, you will say how many things are in the picture! The grownup helping you will press the button.

text: This time, you will choose the button with the right number!
es-CO: ¡Esta vez, elegirás el botón con el número correcto!
de: Dieses Mal wählst du die Taste mit der richtigen Zahl!
fr-CA: This time, you will choose the button with the right number!
nl: This time, you will choose the button with the right number!
de-CH: Dieses Mal wählst du die Taste mit der richtigen Zahl!
es-AR: This time, you will choose the button with the right number!
en-GH: This time, you will choose the button with the right number!

text: This is the memory game.
es-CO: Este es el juego de memoria.
de: Dies ist das Gedächtnisspiel.
fr-CA: This is the memory game.
nl: This is the memory game.
de-CH: Dies ist das Gedächtnisspiel.
es-AR: This is the memory game.
en-GH: This is the memory game.

text: In this game, we are going to see squares light up. Your job is to touch the squares that light up.
es-CO: En este juego, vamos a ver cuadrados encenderse. Tu tarea es tocar los cuadrados que se encienden.
de: In diesem Spiel werden wir sehen, wie Quadrate aufleuchten. Deine Aufgabe ist es, die Quadrate zu berühren, die aufleuchten.
fr-CA: In this game, we are going to see squares light up. Your job is to touch the squares that light up.
nl: In this game, we are going to see squares light up. Your job is to touch the squares that light up.
de-CH: In diesem Spiel werden wir sehen, wie Quadrate aufleuchten. Deine Aufgabe ist es, die Quadrate zu berühren, die aufleuchten.
es-AR: In this game, we are going to see squares light up. Your job is to touch the squares that light up.
en-GH: In this game, we are going to see squares light up. Your job is to touch the squares that light up.

text: Now we will see two squares light up. Your job is to touch the squares in the same order as they light up!
es-CO: Ahora veremos dos cuadrados encenderse. ¡Tu tarea es tocar los cuadrados en el mismo orden en que se encienden!
de: Jetzt werden zwei Quadrate aufleuchten. Deine Aufgabe ist es, die Quadrate in derselben Reihenfolge zu berühren, in der sie aufleuchten!
fr-CA: Now we will see two squares light up. Your job is to touch the squares in the same order as they light up!
nl: Now we will see two squares light up. Your job is to touch the squares in the same order as they light up!
de-CH: Jetzt werden zwei Quadrate aufleuchten. Deine Aufgabe ist es, die Quadrate in derselben Reihenfolge zu berühren, in der sie aufleuchten!
es-AR: Now we will see two squares light up. Your job is to touch the squares in the same order as they light up!
en-GH: Now we will see two squares light up. Your job is to touch the squares in the same order as they light up!

text: Watch the squares light up. I will touch the squares in the same order.
es-CO: Mira cómo se encienden los cuadrados. Tocaré los cuadrados en el mismo orden.
de: Sieh zu, wie die Quadrate aufleuchten. Ich werde die Quadrate in derselben Reihenfolge berühren.
fr-CA: Watch the squares light up. I will touch the squares in the same order.
nl: Watch the squares light up. I will touch the squares in the same order.
de-CH: Sieh zu, wie die Quadrate aufleuchten. Ich werde die Quadrate in derselben Reihenfolge berühren.
es-AR: Watch the squares light up. I will touch the squares in the same order.
en-GH: Watch the squares light up. I will touch the squares in the same order.

text: OK, now you're going to play the rest of the memory game on your own. More squares will light up each time the longer you play, so watch carefully!
es-CO: OK, ahora vas a jugar el resto del juego de memoria por tu cuenta. Más cuadrados se encenderán cada vez que juegues más tiempo, así que ¡mira con atención!
de: Okay, jetzt wirst du den Rest des Gedächtnisspiels alleine spielen. Mehr Quadrate werden aufleuchten, je länger du spielst, also beobachte sorgfältig!
fr-CA: OK, now you're going to play the rest of the memory game on your own. More squares will light up each time the longer you play, so watch carefully!
nl: OK, now you're going to play the rest of the memory game on your own. More squares will light up each time the longer you play, so watch carefully!
de-CH: Okay, jetzt wirst du den Rest des Gedächtnisspiels alleine spielen. Mehr Quadrate werden aufleuchten, je länger du spielst, also beobachte sorgfältig!
es-AR: OK, now you're going to play the rest of the memory game on your own. More squares will light up each time the longer you play, so watch carefully!
en-GH: OK, now you're going to play the rest of the memory game on your own. More squares will light up each time the longer you play, so watch carefully!

text: If you make a mistake, just keep going!
es-CO: Si cometes un error, ¡sigue adelante!
de: Wenn du einen Fehler machst, mach einfach weiter!
fr-CA: If you make a mistake, just keep going!
nl: If you make a mistake, just keep going!
de-CH: Wenn du einen Fehler machst, mach einfach weiter!
es-AR: If you make a mistake, just keep going!
en-GH: If you make a mistake, just keep going!
